title: Art deco ornaments
content:
Can any one show me nice examples of Art deco ornaments?

Thanks
author: display

comments.content: Very Nice Nick - where do they come from -

P22 has a font called Art Deco Extras.  
 [http://www.p22.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209002300/http:/www.p22.com/ "http://www.p22.com")

_Very Nice Nick - where do they come from -_

Originally, from Samuel Welo's _Studio Handbook_ (1926); what you see is from an EPS file that's been sitting around on my hard drive for a couple of years, waiting for me to do something useful with it.

Also worth looking at is the work of [Paul Manship](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209002300/http:/www.nga.gov/cgi-bin/psearch?Request=S&imageset=1&Person=68200), perhaps my favorite Art Deco sculptor (below, yet another piece of art without a home...)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20111209002300im_/http:/typophile.com/files/dancer_6365.gif)
